title: 4 Bistros in Paris for Frugal Feasts
text: EVERY TUESDAY for the past two years, an old man with tortoiseshell glasses has lunched at Les Arlots in Paris’s 10th arrondissement. “He sits in the same seat, at the same hour,” said chef and owner Thomas Brachet. Down a quiet street over in the 20th arrondissement, the same group of seven architects shows up for lunch at least once a week at La Vierge, where the menu changes everyday, making a repeat visit all the more appealing. The price tag is equally attractive. Both Les Arlots and La Vierge offer two or three courses for under 25 euros. The prix fixe, founded by the godfather of French cuisine Georges-Auguste...
description: How to tuck into a divine meal in Paris without forking over a fortune? Stick to lunch. These 4 ambitious neighborhood bistros offer 3-course midday meals for 25 euros or less.
